text: Agrippina may refer to: ==People== * Most women named "Agrippina" were relatives of the Roman general Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa ** Vipsania Agrippina, first wife of the emperor Tiberius, daughter of Pomponia Caecilia Attica and Agrippa ** Vipsania Marcella Agrippina, daughter of Claudia Marcella Major and Agrippa, married to general Publius Quinctilius Varus ** Vipsania Marcellina Agrippina daughter of Claudia Marcella Major and Agrippa, married to Marcus Aemilius Lepidus ** Vipsania Julia Agrippina or Julia the Younger, daughter of Julia the Elder and Agrippa ** Agrippina the Elder or Vipsania Agrippina, daughter of Julia the Elder and Agrippa, wife of Germanicus and mother of emperor Caligula ** Agrippina the Younger or Julia Agrippina, daughter of Agrippina the Elder and Germanicus, wife of emperor Claudius, mother of emperor Nero ** Asinia Agrippina, a possible granddaughter of Vipsania Agrippina * Vibullia Alcia Agrippina, mother of the Greek Senator and sophist Herodes Atticus * Agrippina of Mineo, Christian saint and martyr * Agrippina Fedorovna Chelyadnina, royal governess of Tsar Ivan the Terrible * Agrippina Vaganova, Russian ballerina and ballet teacher * Agrippina de la Cruz, Filipino hurdler ==Insects== * Catocala agrippina * Thysania agrippina * Synechodes agrippina * Midila agrippina * Pseudaletis agrippina * Villa agrippina ==Other uses== *Agrippina (opera), an opera by George Frideric Handel *Agrippina (film), a 1911 Italian film *645 Agrippina, a stony asteroid from the outer region of the asteroid belt ==See also== * * Agrypina, 14th- century Lithuanian noblewoman * Agrippa (disambiguation) * Agrippinus (disambiguation) * Vipsania (disambiguation)
title: Agrippina
